artview.components.Display¶

class artview.components.Display(Vradar, Vfield, Vtilt, Vlims=None, name='Display', parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: artview.core.core.Component

Class that creates a display plot, using a returned Radar structure from the PyArt pyart.graph package.

__init__(Vradar, Vfield, Vtilt, Vlims=None, name='Display', parent=None)[source]¶

Initialize the class to create display.

Parameters :

Vradar : Variable instance

Radar signal variable.

Vfield : Variable instance

Field signal variable.

Vtilt : Variable instance

Tilt signal variable.

[Optional] :

Vlims : Variable instance

Limits signal variable. A value of None will instantiate a limits variable.

name : string

Display window name.

parent : PyQt instance

Parent instance to associate to Display window. If None, then Qt owns, otherwise associated with parent PyQt instance.

Notes

This class records the selected button and passes the change value back to variable.

Methods

Display.FieldSelectCmd(name) Captures field selection and update field Variable.
Display.LaunchGUI() Launches a GUI interface.
Display.NewField(variable, value, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of Vfield.
Display.NewLims(variable, value, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of Vlims.
Display.NewRadar(variable, value, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of Vradar.
Display.NewTilt(variable, value, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of Vtilt.
Display.RngRingSelectCmd(ringSel) Captures Range Ring selection and redraws the field with range rings.
Display.TiltSelectCmd(ntilt) Captures tilt selection and update tilt Variable.
Display.addButtons() Add a series of buttons for user control over display.
Display.cmapSelectCmd(cm_name) Captures colormap selection and redraws.
Display.getPathInteriorValues(path) Return the bins values path.
Display.getPlotAxis() get matplotlib.axes.Axes instance of main plot
Display.getStatusBar() get PyQt4.QtGui.QStatusBar instance
Display.guiStart([parent]) Grafical Interface for Starting this Class
Display.keyPressEvent(event) Reimplementation, allow tilt adjustment via the Up-Down arrow keys.
Display.setUILayout() Setup the button/display UI layout.
Display.toolCustomCmd() Allow user to activate self-defined tool.
Display.toolDefaultCmd() Restore the Display defaults.
Display.toolROICmd() Creates and connects to Region of Interest instance
Display.toolValueClickCmd() Creates and connects to Point-and-click value retrieval
Display.toolZoomPanCmd() Creates and connects to a Zoom/Pan instance.
